item.title: Crisol: Theater of Idols launches February 10
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

First-person horror action adventure game dated.

First-person horror action adventure game Crisol: Theater of Idols will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on February 10 for $17.99, publisher Blumhouse Games and developer Vermila announced. A PC demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via Blumhouse Games:

About

Crisol: Theater of Idols is a gripping first-person horror / action adventure set in the haunting world of Hispania, a nightmarish reimagining of Spain.

Playing as Gabriel, a soldier who can use his own blood as a deadly weapon, you endeavor on a journey to uncover the mysterious disappearance of the Sun God.

Key Features

  • Explore the Cursed Island of Tormentosa – Uncover the chilling history and twisted folklore of Tormentosa, a beautiful but malevolent island. Traverse eerie landscapes, crumbling grand ruins, and labyrinthine streets as you peel back the layers of cults and blood sacrifice.
  • Blood is Your Weapon—and Your Curse – Blood is both your lifeline and your ammunition. Wield this new-found power against terrifying enemies and solve intricate puzzles, but beware: every shot drains your life. Choose wisely—survival hinges on your ability to balance life and death.
  • Manage Your Powers and Weapons – Upgrading the powers that leverage the lethality of blood allows you to deal more damage, fight for longer, and gain bonuses in combat. Navigate myriad weapon options for the right scenario and improve them through coins found in your exploration of Tormentosa.
  • A Story Rooted in Horror and History – Hispania’s disturbing fusion of historical events, folklore, and religious undertones creates a uniquely horrifying world. Face off against staggering statues brought to life and unravel a dark narrative that blurs the line between reality and nightmare.

Prepare to sacrifice everything. How much blood will you shed to uncover the truth?

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: Vampire Crawlers: The Turbo Wildcard from Vampire Survivors demo launches February 23 for Xbox Series, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox Series

New video introduces "Turboturn" and card customization.

poncle will release a demo for roguelite deckbuilder Vampire Crawlers: The Turbo Wildcard from Vampire Survivors for Xbox Series and PC via Steam on February 23, the developer announced.

The company also released the first in a new video series dubbed, “Let’s Explore Vampire Crawlers.” Episode one dives into the following two key mechanics:

  • The Turboturn! – Turn-based combat without the wait. In Vampire Crawlers, you don’t have to pause for animations to complete before triggering your next move. The game intelligently stacks and executes your ability inputs with precision, allowing you to play at your own chaotic pace. It turns tactical combat into a fast, engaging, and visually rewarding experience.
  • Card Customization! – Discover endless ways to play your cards. Gems allow you to customize your cards with a variety of effects, ranging from raw damage multipliers to full Weapon Evolutions. Whether you want a simple power boost or deep strategic planning, Gems give every player the tools to create game-breaking combos.

Vampire Crawlers: The Turbo Wildcard from Vampire Survivors is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, PC via Steam and Microsoft Store, iOS, and Android in early to mid 2026.

Watch the new video below.

Let’s Explore Vampire Crawlers #1



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/vampire-crawlers-the-turbo-wildcard-from-vampire-survivors-demo-launches-february-23-for-xbox-series-pc

item.title: The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct set for January 25
item.content:encoded:
• Nintendo

Another look ahead of April 3 premiere.

Nintendo will host The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct on January 25 at 6:00 a.m. PT / 9:00 a.m. ET / 23:00 JST, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube (America, Europe, Japan).

The broadcast will feature an exclusive look at The Super Mario Galaxy Movie.

The Super Mario Galaxy Movie will premiere on April 3, 2026 in the United States and many additional markets globally, with select territories releasing throughout the month of April.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/the-super-mario-galaxy-movie-direct-set-for-january-25
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Wuthering Waves version 3.1 update ‘For You Who Walk in Snow’ launches February 5
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

Aemeath and Luuk Herssen join the fray.

Kuro Games will release the version 3.1 update for free-to-play open-world action RPG Wuthering Waves, dubbed “For You Who Walk in Snow,” on February 5, the developer announced.

Here is an overview of the update:

Version 3.1 Overview

  • New Main Quests
    • “Chapter III Act III” The Star That Voyages Far
    • “Segue: Afterstory” All That Sunlight Touches
  • Unsigned Good Wishes
    • Claim a total of 1600 Astrites via in-game mail.
  • New Outfit
    • “Perpetual Spark” Rover – Signature Outfit
      • Complete Main Quest Chapter III Act III “The Star That Voyages Far” to obtain the free Outfit “Perpetual Spark” for Rover and associated Avatar.
  • Starpaths Intertwined
    • Obtain Journey Points to unlock and claim Starpath Gifts. For details about the rules, please stay tuned for official announcements.
  • Moonlit Path
    • Obtain Moonlit Rings to unlock and claim rewards. For details about the rules, please stay tuned for official announcements.
  • Optimizations
    • Leveling
      • MainStat Data Modification for Echoes will support batch operations.
      • The Data Merge system will support synthesization of Echoes of target Sonata Sets (this function can be used up to 10 times per week).
      • Optimized the material acquisition process; after the update, clicking on a material’s acquisition path will directly track the enemies that drop the material on the map.
    • Expedition Motorbike
      • In Version 3.1, the Expedition Motorbike will unlock the Glacier Track ability, allowing the motorbike to drive across open water, and it will also unlock a brand-new All-Terrain Tactics module.
      • Autopilot Mode has also been enhanced; when navigating across the map, you can use Fast Travel to teleport to the nearest beacon and activate Autopilot Mode. The relevant visual presentation has been upgraded; the Expedition Motorbike’s dashboard will be equipped with more futuristic lighting and improved color display, and in the first-person view, the dashboard will now be fully visible, creating a more immersive driving experience.
      • Optimized the Expedition Motorbike’s controls on mobile devices. In addition to the existing buttons and swipe-based controls for acceleration, braking, and turning, a new joystick control option will be introduced, which allows you to control the motorbike’s movement direction entirely through the joystick.
      • Improved the Expedition Motorbike’s camera control on mobile devices. When performing Boost or Bounce Jump, you can now adjust the camera view by simply pressing and dragging, without needing to perform swiping actions.
    • Game Performance
      • Optimized the game’s resource loading performance for Version 3.1 and future versions by updating the loading pipeline and accelerating data streaming; these improvements will help reduce loading stutter that may occur on some mobile and PC devices with limited storage or lower spec.
    • Gaming Experience
      • Extended the availability of the Ultra High graphics option to mobile devices equipped with Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, MediaTek Dimensity 9300, or Dimensity 8400.
      • Enhanced the visual details of scene interactions in Version 3.1 to better match the ice and snow environment.
      • For players using controllers on PC or consoles, Version 3.1 will introduce controller vibration support across more gameplay scenarios.
    • Stay tuned to official announcements for updates on more optimizations.
  • New Resonators
    • Aemeath
    • Luuk Herssen
  • Upcoming Featured Resonator Convene
    • Phase I
      • Take Flight in Spring
      • Horizon of Dawnbreak
      • Roar of Triumph
    • Phase II
      • When Winter Thaws
      • From Ashes
  • New Weapons
    • Everbright Polestar
    • Daybreaker’s Spine
  • Upcoming Featured Weapon Convene
    • Phase I
      • Everbright Polestar
      • Kumokiri
      • Wildfire Mark
    • Phase II
      • Daybreaker’s Spine
      • Lux & Umbra
  • Special Events
    • Where Stars Cascade Down – Limited-Time Event
    • Gifts of Soft Snow – 7-Day Login Event
    • Full Throttle! Bolt & Blitz! – Leisure Event
    • Unfrozen Traces – Area Exploration Event
    • Footprints on Frostlands – Photo Collection Event
    • Rein Back! Migration Mayhem! – Leisure Event
    • Peaks of Prestige: Rekindled Duel – Echo Combat Event
    • Blade Hunter: Wilderness – Featured Combat Everit
    • TERM-X: Outreach – Exploration Event
    • Lollo Campaign: Implementation – Featured Commission Event
    • Veins of the Frostlands – Web Event
  • New Echoes
    • Sigillum
    • Nameless Explorer
    • Reminiscence Kronaclaw
    • Kronablight
    • Glammoth
    • Iceglint Dancer
    • Shadow Stepper
  • New Sonata Effects
    • Trailblazing Star
    • Chromatic Foam
    • Sound of True Name
  • New Phantom Echo
    • Phantom: Sigillum
    • Phantom: Iceglint Dancer
  • New Tactical Hologram Challenge
    • Tactical Hologram: Reactor Husk
  • New Area
    • Roya Frostlands – Frostlands Surface

Wuthering Waves is available now for PlayStation 5, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play. The PC version will also be available via Steam starting April 29.

Watch a new set of trailers below.

item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road second free major update ‘Ares & Fabled Seed DLC’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
LEVEL-5 has released a trailer for Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road‘s second free major update, “Ares & Fabled Seed DLC,” which is due out on January 28.

As previously announced, the update will introduce new features, including the opening of the Ares Route in Chronicle Mode, where players can “enjoy a blazing football drama about boys and girls striving for the very top.”

LEVEL-5 will also distribute a special item, “Fabled Seed,” which allows every player to upgrade one character of their choice to Fabled—the rarity introduced in the first free major update.

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch the trailer below.

Free Major Update “Ares & Fabled Seed DLC” Trailer

English

Japanese
